extendedInfo.description: Evernote Food 2.0 is now available on Android!Evernote Food helps you remember the food you love. From discovering great recipes and restaurants to capturing your memorable food experiences, Evernote Food is the one app you need to remember your life in food.â¢ Explore the best recipes from across the web and save them to My Cookbook to try laterâ¢ Find great restaurants near you or anywhere in the world; add them to your wish list or book a reservationâ¢ Document your food experiences through photos, notes, & locationsâ¢ Share your meals with friends through e-mail, Twitter, Facebook, or linksBonus: Since Evernote Food is part of Evernote, recipes you clip using Evernote Web Clipper on your desktop will also appear in the the My Cookbook section of the app. Use tags to organize them based on diet and ingredients.Additionally, anything you save in Evernote Food will show up in Evernote on any device you use.What's new in Evernote Food 2.0â¢ Explore Recipes - Thousands of recipes from the best food sites to browse, search, and save.â¢ My Cookbook - Recipes you save in the app, plus ones you've clipped or saved in Evernote, show up here, making them easy to find from any device.â¢ Restaurants - A location-based list and map view of restaurants that lets you clip and save the ones you want to try and see all the spots you've visited.â¢ My Meals - A photographic journey through all of your past meals and food adventures.Here are just a few ways you can use Evernote Food:â¢ Build your own online cookbook using My Cookbook, where you can save favorite and new recipes you want to try. â¢ Document each step of recipe preparation with photos and captions, from new creations to family traditions you want to preserve.â¢ Discover restaurants by location or cuisine and create a list of ones to visit in your city and for travel destinations. Book your table within the app using OpenTable.â¢ Remember culinary journeys using My Meals. Add images and notes on the food, wine, people, and ambience that make trips memorable.â¢ Capture your food memories of special restaurant or home-cooked meals enjoyed with family and friends. Take note of dishes you love so you can order them again.Learn more: http://evernote.com/food/Follow Evernote Food on Twitter: twitter.com/evernote

reviews.title: Disappointed not as well thought out as evernote
reviews.comment: Its two stars till I can import recipes from other sources. Can\'t import from even evernote!  How disappointing!!!  Very limited and shortsighted. Please fix this.
reviews.author: Nicolle Cranz

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: I love this app! It is easy to use, fun, and it has a lot of great recipes :-)
reviews.author: Shay H.

reviews.title: It\'s not clear to me how to best use Evernote food.
reviews.comment: Is it Yelp? Is it a food diary? Is it a recipe book? The short answer is Yes, bit with qualifications.
reviews.author: Adam Goyer

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: So much fun but can you please add a feature to take pics of servers and table guest more fun when remembering who the meal was shared with:) and a social feature to share.
reviews.author: Kari Hill

reviews.title: Mm mmm good!
reviews.comment: I love this app. You can find everything you need to make dinner in one place. If you\'re in a hurry there is quick stuff and even healthy stuff. I love this app!
reviews.author: Alicia Chavis

reviews.title: Motorola photon
reviews.comment: No keyboard for changing search terms when in \"web\" search.  Otherwise I like it!  Great to have recipes in one place, with tags.
reviews.author: Lisa Marshall

reviews.title: LOVE this app...but a few glitches
reviews.comment: Not only did it import all the recipes I already had in Evernote but I can easily clip new recipes from the \"explore\" feature. I often browse through the recipes on my phone when I am waiting around at appointments. This app is a must have for anyone who loves to cook.  The downside is....recipes that I have clipped, it does not show the whole recipe. I tried to follow a recipe I clipped tonight and it showed only the steps and not the ingredients list. This is a huge problem and very frustrating.
reviews.author: Christina Marie

reviews.title: Good app...
reviews.comment: Now that I have used it a bit and found the \"My Meals\" portion of the app I like the ability to record my meals at various restaurants.
reviews.author: Justin Lunski

reviews.title: Samsung Proclaim SCH S720C
reviews.comment: The design of the app is very nice. The recipes are also very good being conventional, vegetarian, gourmet or quick and easy. Whatever you\'re looking for. Would be nice to customize the explore recipes page to if I only want salmon recipes or bread recipes to populate. 2 complaints tho- recipe pages load very slowly, and my keyboard doesn\'t appear when I would like to comment on a post/recipe. I\'ll keep it for awhile and see if it gets better... Thx.
reviews.author: justin martin

reviews.title: Great app. Great job developers.
reviews.comment: Very Nice app. Faster than Yelp. The only drawback is that it does not offer as much info about restaurants as Yelp does. Otherwise, flawless.  Thank you developers.
reviews.author: Denis Barengolts

reviews.title: Useful but needs a little refining
reviews.comment: This is easier than searching for recipies in the main Evernote app.  I\'ve found noting favourite restaurant meals useful for Thai and Indian restaurants where the names are tricky to remember. I haven\'t bothered to use it for European food. I have two complaints. Firstly it uses Four Square for addresess and it only seems to list big chain restaurants. Secondly, my restaurant meals aren\'t added to my main Evernote app.
reviews.author: Luke Nicolaides

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Like another popular app w/ shared ideas - including recipes - Evernote Food offers great ideas from popular Web sites. I love to search & clip the recipes that interest me. I also like that the app is integrated w/ the main Evernote app, though some recipes I have in my \"recipe\" folder will not transfer over.  Searching restaurants is a little lacking, as only a small selection of the restaurants where I spend the most time are actually available when performing a search.
reviews.author: Deborah Cooper

reviews.title: Ability to post multiple pictures
reviews.comment: Perfect for foodies (or wannabes) who like keeping track of what they ate, and where. I also use it to store info on craft beers.
reviews.author: Krista Escobar

reviews.comment: Simple and useful recipe book!
reviews.author: Thomas Boyko

reviews.title: Fotos disappeared
reviews.comment: Fotos are missing in the home page of my meal. It appears only if a specific meal is opened.
reviews.author: piglet momo

reviews.title: Loved
reviews.comment: Very useful app, especially when travel. Easy to use, and loved.
reviews.author: C Mo

reviews.title: Not as impressed as I hoped to be
reviews.comment: I already use the Evernote original app and thought the Food app sounded good. However, I\'m disappointed there isn\'t the option to add a direct link to the website I got a recipe from when adding recipes I\'ve cooked. I can add a link to the notes area but it doesn\'t then work when I reopen the saved note.
reviews.author: Anne Neal

reviews.title: [BUG] worked great until it stopped syncing
reviews.comment: I think it\'s because I changed evernote password, but Food never reminded me to re-login, causing me to have a dozen meals added after it stopped syncing before I even noticed. Doesn\'t work anymore even if I change the password back. Cannot share the unsynced meals also (for backup so that I can log out and in again)  Browsed the internet and the issue has been there ever since, and still no official fix.
reviews.author: Hermy Gao

reviews.title: Foodies rejoice
reviews.comment: This app is great for organized food junkies and helps with nutritional ideas.
reviews.author: Emerson Whitfield

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Cool little app to keep track of where you have eaten. Also good for finding restaurants too.
reviews.author: Sian Lunt
